text: Tap. Hazy golden body with an average white head. Aroma of tangeriin, lime zest, mango and herbal notes. Sweet flavor that ends up being more dry and pleasant bitter. Medium bodied, watery to oily texture and soft carbonation. A very nice APA indeed. ðŸŒŸðŸŒŸðŸŒŸðŸŒŸ

Keg at Omnipollos Hatt, Stockholm.  Cloudy golden, rich creamy head. Juicy floral nose with pears and pineapple. Sweet with medium body and rounded mouthfeel. Syrup and saccharine, some hay, mango and lychee. Mid bitter finish with saccharine burn and resin. Disharmonious.

Bottle... Cloudy, florescent, peach-colored pour with a razor-thin slice of creamy, white head that diminishes to a small, white collar. The aroma features fuzzy fruits, tropical fruits and light muskiness. Full-bodied with champagne-like carbonation. The flavor is both lightly tart and medium-bitter accompanied by cereal grains. Lengthy, lightly acidic, mildly bitter finish. Bottle courtesy of biggsbowler!

Tallboy can thanks to Tracy G. Poured an awesome looking opaque bright orange with an average sized tight foamy bright white head. Aroma/flavor of rotting sweet sugary citrus, apricot, mango, kiwi, guava, Arma lade topped dough. Flavor is a little more grainy and malty. Fuller mouthfeel with average tight bubbly carbonation. Solid but sweet.

Pours murky milky light ripe banana with low white head 
Aromas hoppy of tropical fruits, lactose, oats, 
Taste has hoppy juicy notes of tropical fruits, mango, pine, caramel, grass, oats

Draught at Omnipollos Hatt. Hazy deep orange liquid with medium off-white head. Aroma of citrus, fresh hops, light weed, pineapple and passion fruit. Taste is dry and light to medium bitter with notes of pineapple, citrus, mango, fresh hops and light grain. Medium bodied with medium carbonation. Great stuff.
16oz can pours a hazy yellow amber color with a bit of head. Intense piney hops. Bitterness lingers.

Tall can pours with a murky deep gold body that supports a near white head. The modest aroma a blend of spicy dank onion hops, tropical fruity hops and some grapefruit with a faint malt background. The taste begins with smooth grapefruit and pineapple and malts that are both bitter and juicy and then heading into slivers of bitter dank onion hoppiness. Wow. This is banginÂ’ on all cylinders.

Can from March 21
Pours hazy orange hue with a small soapy white head and great lacing. Nose is pure dry hopped heaven huge floral tropical notes. Lemons mustard wow some great complexity. Bright hop flavors lots of juicy citrus. Great stuff!
Cloudy pale yellow gold, quite opaque. White head. Mango, some deeper earthiness, dankness. More than lightly bitter, quite dry. Light body, some light lingering oiliness. Longer finish. Excellent.

7/XII/16 - 1Pt. can from a trade, shared @ Yet Another Trillium Tasting (home) - BB: n/a, canned: VIII/26/16 (2016-1449) Thanks to Kris for the trade and to Thomas for muling!
Clear orange beer, creamy irregular off-white head, little stable, bit adhesive. Aroma: very fruity, lots of pineapple, mango, sweet touch, very nice. MF: ok carbon, medium body. Taste: sweet start, very fruity, lots of pineapple, mango, passion fruit, grapefruit. Aftertaste: bit sweet, very fruity, grapefruit, mango, malty touch, very nice!
No spoko, od cholery Mosaika, takÅ¼e w postaci zielonej cebulki. TrochÄ™ owocÃ³w, sporo Å¼ywic, bardzo pijalne, lekkie, goryczka Å‚adna. Bdb.

Can. It pours a cloudy orange color with some floaties and a small off white head. The aroma is dank and tropical with orange and pineapple. The flavor has more dank orange, pineapple and low to medium dank bitterness. Light to medium bodied and somewhat chewy on the palate. Good.

Aroma: Orange pith, wild berries, grapefruit skin, pine, just a massive burst of citrus, with that dank mosaic character right behind it. Taste: Big orange in the mouth, more grapefruit and then some elderberry. All of this is complimented by a luscious mouthfeel & soft bitterness on the finish. Overall: Best pale ale IÂ’ve ever tasted, hands down.

16oz can, Really well made, but not really the all out Mosaic monster I was hoping for. Frankly, this is some overpriced stuff. Floaties in the unfiltered orange body. A tasty, nice beer for sure, but not special enough to justify the high pricepoint.
Growler. Burnt orange pour with a white head. Citrus and orange notes dominate. Tasty with a sturdy caramel malt backbone. Good body and mouthfeel.

Growler that had a long trip here. A little flat, otherwise superb. Cloudy orange with some head still. Fruity mango pineapple citrusy goodness. Low to medium bitterness. Still ridiculously crushable.

Pint can. Light golden color. Fairly cloudy, lots of yeast floaties. Solid off-white head. Lots of sweet fruity hoppiness. Big passionfruit, mango. Some minty herbal action. Light, sweet citrus, candied lemon. Light grassiness. Mild crackery malt base. Mildly dry in taste. Lots of sweet hoppiness. Some light malt sweetness. Refreshing and easy to drink. Light body. Some hop oiliness. Not quite what I expected but very good.

Thanks Huhzubendah for sharing the can! Poured into a taster showing hazy orange with sparse white foam. 

The nose shows cannabis with light guava and passionfruit. 

The palate is medium bodied and moderately carbonated. Strong dank cannabis flavor with a moderate malt backbone. Light bitterness on the finish. Most might complain itÂ’s not hop-forward enough but as it is a pale ale, the style doesnÂ’t demand as much and in my opinion, is still very well done.
Can at tderoeckÂ’s place, thanks for sharing! Citrus, pretty neat, some bitter and passion fruit. Loveleh.
Drank from a sample glass, poured from a sixteen ounce can. Thank you Dusty!

16oz can thanks to Steve. Pours out a hazy cloudy gold topped with a white head. Nose is great big tropical fruit hop melon and a nice malt note. Taste is more of the great tropical fruit notes melon hops this is very nice.

ApelsingulsfÃ¤rg, grumlig, jÃ¤stfÃ¤llning med friska dofter av citrus & grapefrukt Ã¥ tropiska juicer av olika slag, doften gÃ¥r igenom i smaken med apelsin & citronjuice och med en hÃ¤rlig efterbeska som ligger kvar, vÃ¤lbalanserad! Magisk!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

16 oz can shared by ebone1988. The pour is a turbid juicy orange with a thick pale dandelion colored head that falls down leaving a good lace. The aroma is really good. Juicy and dominated by mosaic hop. The bitterness is nice. ItÂ’s well balanced and just so smooth. The dry hop really works well with the juiciness. The flavor is pretty good. There is a dry bitter hop. Definitely mosaic, but itÂ’s a little more relaxed than the normal Fort Point. The resin is pretty big on the back end. The mouth feel is light and crisp with a great carbonation and a lingeringly bitter aftertaste. This definitely isnÂ’t as good as the regular collection of hops, but itÂ’s good.

Can shared with koleminer20. Yowza. Aroma is citrus, dank, tropical fruit, pine, resin, fucking good. Appearance is orange juice, hazy, off yellow head. Taste is very dank, pine, citrus juice, tropical fruit, bitter, great. Mouthfeel is light body, light crisp carbonation, bitter dry pine aftertaste. Overall, very good stuff here.

CaN at tbrrr .. . hazy gold skin .. awesome foam .. looks jumpin .. . grass, leaves, sap, resin, bitter socks .. grungy bitterness with a juicy splash .. itÂ’s a fun one, warming on trillium .. . . 

i donÂ’t trust people who donÂ’t eat their pizza crusts. fuckin wasteful savages!!

can dated 7/5/16..mofopo..pours a hazy orange with particles abound seemingly suspended in beer..nose is off the charts and can be found straight from the pop of the can..this is a juice bomb for sure..all kinds of orange, dried mango, tangerine..mouthfeel is perhaps even better than the wonderful aromas, light, yet juicy, no real dominant bitterness but enough hoppy dankness to keep things interesting, and complex,fruity/hoppy mix of flavors really coats the palate, extremely clean, refreshing, oh my this is an absolutely wonderful offering from Trillium, great lacing all around, call this a pale ale, ipa, whatever you want to call it, this is a world class offering and the best of what I have tried from Trillium for sure, yes I would like mofopo..or more fort point to be exact, this mosaic dry hopped version is worthy..

Can courtesy of Max; shared with Paul. Pours a deep, bright murky peach-colored body with nice thick, spotty white lacing. Nose is rich, juicy tropical fruits and soft dank character. Perfectly executed, juicy mouthfeel chock-full of funky melon, dank fruits, strawberry and pineapple. Juicy and sessionable. Great offering from Trillium.

Tasted on 7/17/16 from a twelve day old 16oz can, big thanks to Alex. Pours cloudy orange with a thick white head that slowly recedes to sticky, average lace. The nose is straight fruit juice. A mixture of passion fruit, orange, pineapple, and grapefruit, some herbal floral notes, and just a bit of dank yeast. The flavor is the same, super juicy, tons of fruit, very pretty and floral, with just the faintest hint of bitterness. The body is light with average carbonation, and a long lightly bitter and ton of tropical fruit finish.

Bottle @ MikeÂ’s House. Thanks! Pretty nice beer, despite the usual haze and ugliness here. Really juicy grapefruit, pineapple, and mango. Has a bit of sweet peach, too. Slight bready malt in the background, mostly on the tongue. Actually has a decent "dank" to it and some moderate bitterness of oily citrus and a touch of pine and onion.

JÂ’ai dÃ©gustÃ©e cette biÃ¨re Ã  quelques jours dÂ’intervalle de sa version rÃ©guliÃ¨re, et la comparaison est nÃ©cessairement naturelle entre les deux. LÂ’apparence est la mÃªme, un liquide blond et dorÃ©, et lÂ’arÃ´me est la mÃªme - une bombe houblonnÃ©e aux arÃ´mes exotiques puissants. La diffÃ©rence est en bouche. On retrouve dÃ©finitivement le goÃ»t exotique en bouche, mais Ã©galement une bonne amertume, une plus grande amertume que chez la Fort Point rÃ©guliÃ¨re. Plus les gorgÃ©es sÂ’enlignent, plus cette amertume devient de plus en plus prÃ©sente. Pas que cÂ’est dÃ©sagrÃ©able, loin de lÃ , mais la buvabilitÃ© de cette Fort Point sÂ’effrite quelque peu. Ã‡a reste une excellente, excellente biÃ¨re; la Fort Point originale est toutefois un chef dÂ’oeuvre.
750 ml. bottle. Pours a hazy golden orange with a nice white head. Aroma of tropical, citrus, and grass. Taste is a tropical feast, citrus, malt, grass, and a touch of pine. Delicious++

Well rounded tropical and citrus on the nose before it goes down the hatch. Add pepper biscuits (if youÂ’ve had one you know what I mean), dank onion and rosemary aromas once itÂ’s in the hatch. Finishes fast and clean. I would add pineapple to the label, otherwise the deScription is spot on. One of the best APAÂ’s IÂ’ve had.

Bottle. Pours a hazed and somewhat opaque golden peach with a large white head. Smells of honeyed tea and soft honeyed musk, fuzzy and just bursting with kumquats and a touch of cinnamon. Medium bodied, sweet musk and warm honeyed citrus. Spicy citrus, musk, a touch of yeast. Fuzzy musk into the finish, more sweet citrus. A touch of warming alcohol, with more honeyed citrus tea notes. A joy to drink.

Hazy golden orange in color... Aroma is dank yet tropical, mango, tropical fruits on nose... Flavor has lots of herbal, peppery notes, moderately dank, with mango, pineapple, citrus... Really nice pale ale

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On tap at Hatten. 

Hazy yellow with a small white head. Fresh and hoppy aroma of pineapple, light hay, grapefruit and mango. Similar taste. Quite soft and with a medium bitter finish. Balanced and nicely drinkable. An excellent one.

Pours hazy mango with a medium foamy white head. Aromas of mango, citrus, slight vanilla, apricot, peach. Taste is very fruity with moderate bitterness Ã¤r. Mouthfeel is creamy and juicy with moderate carbonation.
@ Hatten 16-4-9: Riktigt trevlig med stor vÃ¤lbalanserad humlesmak. Stora toner av ananas och passionsfrukt.

Draught at Hatten.
Thick hazy yellow, short creamy head.
Minty, juicy aroma with citrus and mango and some chlorine/bathroom (think itÂ’s the glass. Not so aromatic.
Taste on the other hand is juicy fresh with mango and citrus and some slight bitter zest. Clean and straight forward. Medium bitterness.
Medium body, low carbonation, thick juicy texture.
ItÂ’s good. More like juice.

ottle courtesy of rlgk. Pours very hazy yellow with a small creamy white head that leaves lots of spotty trace on the glass while dissipating. Smell is slightly fruity and grassy with crackers, grapefruit juice, pineapple, star fruit, freshly cut grass, pine needles, lemongrass, lime leaves, Thai basil, minerals and lemon zest. Taste is bitter, very tiny sour, fruity and grassy. Mouthfeel is soft, dry, slightly astringent and medium bodied. Finish is bitter with star fruit, pineapple, watermelon and peppery grassy hops. Simple and to the delicious point.

Sample at The Trillium and Tree House-tasting in Kville, GÃ¶teborg. Hazy pale golden beer with a nice offwhite head. Hoppy pine aroma, peach, pine apple notes, lemon zest, mango, citrus, tangerine, orange, some grapes. Amazing pine and peach flavor, mango, lemon zest, tangerines, pine apples, slightly spicy herbal. Crazy good complex beer, aning the best hoppy beers I have tried.

(Bottle) Pours cloudy yellow with an off-White head. The aroma holds violet candy, strawberry jam, herbs, juicy yellow fruits and bready, cracker-like malt. The flavour is light sweet to dry, near heavily bitter and light acidic with citrus, tropic fruits, herbs and tight malt. The mouthfeel is numbing and soft. Medium carbonation. Near medium bodied.
Pours murky golden with a small off white head. Aroma is fruity fruity passion fruit citrus fresh hops dry. Flavor is very fresh pungent hoppy fruity citrucy.

A: Cloudy yellow coloured with a white head that foes away fast. N: Pine, tropical fruits, forest, grapefruit T: Pine, passionfruit, lemon, lime, mango O: Wow! Amazing well balanced flavours! Love it!

Bomber tGilhanks to bigda83! Pours an opaque yellow from the bottle with fluffy white head that dissipates to leave mnoderate ar1ce. Aroma of intense fruity and resinous earthy hop notes, hints of strawberry. Taste follows, super hoppy, really well balanced. Again, new England shit looks like garbage water, but tastes great.

UPDATED: SEP 22, 2016 September 22, 2016. Can, courtesy of tom10101, thanks! 
Extremely juicy and drinkable! 

Original rating:

March 11, 2016. Bottle, courtesy of James, thanks! 
Cloudy orange with a large creamy head. Aroma is citrusy with grapefruit and orange, passionfruit, notes of pineapple and mango, onion, bread and light herbal. Taste is light to medium sweet, medium soft bitterness. Finish is sweet fruity and some toasted malt, hints of mango and pineapple, bitter orange zest, passionfruit, some herbal chive notes. Medium bodied, soft to average carbonation. 
Another nice one from Trillium.

9-4-8-4-18=43

Another excellent member of the "Fort Point" pale ale family. Dank, pungent, creamy-smooth, and dry like all of the Fort Points, but this one showcases Mosaic hops. ThereÂ’s a bit of the "soapy" flavor that IÂ’ve noticed in other Mosaic beers, but Trillium does what they do best and makes magic out of a ton of hops, and the end result is a fantastic beer that smells like tropical fruit and tastes rich and dank.
Bottle shared by a friend. Pours clear amber with a thick off-white head. Aroma of pine, malt and citrus. Malty flavor with grapefruit before a piney finish.

750 mL bottle. Hazy orange. Smell is quite dank. Strong mosaic garlic aroma. Melons and mangoes behind it. Tastes more tropical up front. Orange and mangoes. The garlic bite isnÂ’t until later with the grain flavor comes through. Surprisingly earthy in the back end. Medium body. The earthiness is a little odd, but itÂ’s otherwise delicious.

Bottle shared by Al, pours hazy orange color. Smell is dank orange and cheese with some tangerine and dry malt in the end. Taste is most of the same with a nice bread/orange grapefruit combo. Medium bodied with moderate bitterness. Really nice but last years mosaic crop was so much danker, but this executed extremely well. If columbus wasnÂ’t the other hop it would be even better.

Bottle. The pour is a vibrant hazy orange. The aroma is hoppiness joy, a sweet blend just screams out drink me. The taste is very good, smooth and a top tier pale ale fore sure. Comparing to the Galaxy version, this one falls a little short.

Bottle. Pours a super hazy orange golden with a small bubbled somewhat lasting white head and sticky lace. Tropical nose jumps out of the box immediately; papaya, passion fruit, sweet juicy mango, tangerine. Could not smell any better for what I love in an pale/ipa. Flavor follows suit--lots of tropical notes, minimum bitterness, but not really sweet at all. Its amazing how Trillium crafts these pales to pull out all of these awesome hop flavors without any of the residual bitterness and keeps the malt/sugar content so low. Truly remarkable craftsmanship.

Hazy dark golden body, medium to large off-white head, and soapy lacing. Herbal mango, passion fruit, light cracker, and some grass. Medium bodied with moderate carbonation, lively bitterness, clean finish.

Bomber. Cloudy copper gold with a thick, foamy, off white head that lasts in a ring and laces some. Aromas of mango, wheat, herbs, passion fruit, lime, light spice and earthy notes. Flavor is wheat, herbs, pine, mango, lime, light earthy spice, and biscuit. Medium bodied, crisp and dry.

Another wonderful hop bomb, though the pier was superior. Some tangerine and peel, some breadfruit and almost a durian kind of thang. Hazy amber pour with great head and lacing. Bitter finish. Tap at Canton brewery.

Lil Tuesday Tasting in Odense. Slightly hazy golden with a big white head. Hoppy aroma with lots of grapefruit, some tangerine, and a hint of kerosene. Sweetish, hoppy flavour with lots of citrus peel. IÂ’m not a fan of the bitterness

This brew pours a hazy golden color with a medium ivory white head that diminishes gradually to a film. Partial rings of lacing on the glass. Aroma of tropical fruit, hops and malt. Medium body with flavors of juicy citrus and apricots, herbal hops and biscuit malt. The finish is moderately bitter with a citrusy hops aftertaste. Very good Pale Ale overall.
Bomber shared at Darkness day. Clear golden pour. Citrus hop aroma. Taste follows with nice clean finish. Good stuff.

From bottle. Pours hazy golden with a white head. Aroma of tangerine, citrus, floral, bubblegum. Taste is amazing, full of tropical and tangerine notes, fresh, dry, perfectly balanced, super fruity, peach, light apricot. Sweet jebus, this is great!
Bottle. Pours golden with a golden head. Aroma of skunk, tropical, orange, citrus, grape, light earthy, very fresh. Taste is bitter, fresh, hop, thislte, fruity, passion. Very well done.

Bottle @ Rekvium, Orla and DolleÂ’s dÃ¸dsyge sÃ¸ndagssmagning, 2015. Pours hazy golden with a creamy white head and lacings. Fruity hops, tangerine, bread, pineapple. Juicy and dry. Sticky. UffinÂ’ lovely!

Sampled from the bottle. Pours a clear amber gold with a tan head that dissipates to the edges. Aroma has pine, grass and earthy citrus with a grain backbone. Flavor has sweet citrus, grass and light pine with a light grain backbone.
Bomber. Hazy golden yellow pour with a smaller white head. Killer Mosaic citrusy tropical nose. Soft palate. Tasty stuff.

Brand new bottle from the brewery. Clear orange color, lots of foam. Powerful aromas of tropical fruit, a bit dank. Similar flavor profile, medium bitter. Tastes like an IPA but much cleaner, lighter after taste. Terrific.
Gold pour, small white head. Fantastic juicy aroma: orange blossom, pineapple, mango and pine. Flavor of pine, grass, fruit and dank hops.

Pours a slightly hazed golden yellow with a small white sudsy head. Aroma of citrus and tropical fruits, hints of onion, and pine. Flavor is mango, orange, grapefruit, light onion. Medium body, slick texture, nicely carbed. Easy drinking with some bitterness to end. Nice.

Bottled on 4/8/15, conditioned in bottom of cold refrigerator until 5/20/15Well well, IÂ’m sitting here with the 205th Highest ranked beer in the world. ThatÂ’s no small feat. You have to get past the homers, the haters and the people that dont like IPAs or just had a bad batch....(and with this small, not quite overly consistent brewery, thatÂ’s saying a lot). I figured the tradeoff between not drinking an IPA as absolutely fresh as possible, and letting this massive hop particulate settle was high enough that it would be more enjoyable now; whether IÂ’m right or wrong IÂ’ll never know. The beer is certainly in lovely condition; down to an only slight haziness (mostly chill haze) with a massive, well-retained head.The aroma is all stone fruit and lime. I guess this hop is a hybrid of simcoe? It dosent have the sheer power and I guess that the best Simcoe IPAs easily out-aroma the best Mosaic IPAs. But of course, this is only the dry hop. Fort point itself adds plentiful mango, citrus and light pine. The pine is certainly there, but absolutely free of any resin or acidity. ItÂ’s as if theyÂ’ve centrifuged the acidity out of the beer. Watermelon, lime, and grapefruit continue. ItÂ’s certainly highly aromatic and sniffable, with soft, yet very apparent honeyed malts sitting in the background. I initially thought Fort Point a very dry pale ale; itÂ’s not. ItÂ’s a very, very hoppy pale ale that is completed by the sweet, succulent honey notes that remain mostly out-of-mind while the hops go to work on the palate. Extremely juicy, heavy watermelon, ruby red grapefruit and yet, dare I say, a bit too much malt sugar. I found it in the Double Dry Hopped version and here itÂ’s inescapable. As well, this is from the end of the second glass, when the beer is still quite chilled.Importantly, of course, itÂ’s not too sweet, in an overall sense. As with all of the best beers, this is nitpicking, but I think TrilliumÂ’s in a state where they are so far, far, far behind demand that they have neither luxury of changing their yeast aggressively nor giving extra conditioning time to their beers. And I wholeheartedly apologize if IÂ’m wrong, but thatÂ’s how it comes off to me. I get a bit of astringency/doughiness from most of their beers now, which works against the overall snappiness/crispness.That all aside, this is certainly a top-notch beer, and no doubt when they make their impending move, they are going to really shake up the Boston beer scene. This little brewery has done so much for Boston and the best is certainly yet to come (as cliche and lame as that sounds, itÂ’s true).As with all of their beers, the carbonation is perfect, with a soft, creamy texture and well-attenuated malts.

Bottle 750ml.
Pours golden with high white head. Nice lacing. Aroma is of garlic, fruits, citrus. Taste is of garlic, tropical fruits, yuzu, bitterness, citrus. Palate: Light-medium body. Soft-medium carbonation. Overall: Very nice. Awesome hops.

Pours a lightly hazy golden with a small white head that leaves good lacing. Nose carries some light garlic (but nothing bad) and tropical fruits. Taste is moderately sweet and bitter and is fruity. Flavors of apricots, mangoes, oranges and all kinds of tropical fruits. Body is medium, carbonation moderately high. Juicy like all Trillium IPAs. Overall another solid/world class IPA by Trillium, very nice!

bottle courtesy of tom10101, many thanks bro! pours unclear bright golden with a creamy towering white head, excellent retention and lacing. garlic-y citrus, danky melons, very tropical - pienapple; strawberries, mint, lean honeyed maltiness, clean yeast. light carbonation, light body - oily; balanced and fluffy spicy-citrusy finish. excellent like its galaxy declension!

750ml bottle pours a hazy orange gold with some lacing, white head. Nose is crazy, super dank, tons of fruit, chive, oniony, guava, pineapple, orange marmalade, grassy. Unpack this nose and tell me itÂ’s NOT a 10. Flavor is all fruit, guava, pineapple, orange, mango, maybe a little yeasty, some green apple (not in a bad way). Finishes clean. Excellent.
bottle, Amazing IPA, dank bitterness, amazing flavor & balance. Orange led citrus hop notes, a touch grassy. really impressive
One of my favorite breweries. Always a citrus fruity bomb of hops. Mouthfeel is great and appeasing. I'd pair this with some spicy tacos.
Bottle, pour is hazy yellow. Aroma is dank and grassy. Taste is medium bodied with a creamy mouthfeel and medium dry bitter finish

UPDATED: APR 20, 2015 Live from NH. Bottle (750 ml). Bottle 08-04-2015, so 10 days old. Bottle from Jon, thanks! Split 3-ways with Chris and Julien.

Appearance: Hazy glowing orange with a medium white head and good lacing. 

Aroma: Wow! Dank hops, citrus, creamsicle, perfumy... all brought up intensely like essential oils. 

Taste: A bit less intense than aroma, but still mightily delicious. Dank, good malt backone and citrus.

Palate: Medium body. Moderate carbonation. Super oily mouthfeel. Juicy. Dry finish. 

Overall: Another superb IPA from Trillium. Great aroma depth, really tasty and high drinkability level. Loved it.

Bottle shared, bottled a week ago. Glowing hazy gold amber pour with rich white head, light lacing. Aroma is amazing, rich, multi-layered complex dank hop aroma, rich, perfumy, orange, creamsicle. Taste is super hoppy, rich dank sweet juicy hoppy flavor, orange, weed. Palate is med-light bodied with soft carbonation, dry finish. Very very good, Trillium has lately been blowing my standards for hoppy beer out of the water.
Pours a pale orange with a white lacing. The aroma is creamsicle, grapefruit and pine.

750 ml bottle poured into a tulip. Bottled 3/4/2015. Hazy golden orange with nice 2-3 fingers of off-white head. Aromas of citrus fruit and peel, floral, some tropical fruit, maybe a bit of onion/garlic. Tastes of bright orange and grapefruit citrus, floral notes, tropical fruit, a little pine. Medium body with a semi-dry finish. Medium carbonation, juicy mouthfeel. Citrusy delicious!

Bottle. Pours murky orange with thin bubbly head. Mild carbonation over superior hop aroma. Complex hop flavor generally associated with VT brews. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Golden, green hued, slightly hazy with frothy white foam. Citrus and diesel aromas. Lightly sweet finish and body is a bit soft on an otherwise noteworthy beer. A touch too sweet but still pretty good. Might benefit from greater acidity.
Pours clear golden, frothy white head. Big tangerine nose, melon, cantaloupe, grass, dank weed resin. Flavor is mostly the same. Gooey fruity mouthfeel, dry finish. Stupid good.

750 ml bottle dated 03 04 15Â… thanks to Willrunforbeer, awesome! Murky straw color with some light head in the snifter. Aroma is great, leafy green dank notes. Love the onion and scallions notes. The flavor shows a nice level of pale malt backbone with citrus to balance the danky notes. Great mouthfeel, fuller side of medium.
Poured from bottle thanks Willrunforbeer. Hazy deep golden color with thin white head. Aromas of fresh citrus and hop. Taste is juicy with a nicely balanced hop finish.

750mL dated 030415 shared 3 ways. Pours bright orange gold with a big off white head. Aroma is mango, passion fruit, scallion. Taste follows, juicy and tropical, with just enough scallion to balance. Not to sweet, not too bitter. Great IPA.
Bottl. Golden pour with white head. Herbal, grassy and dank hop aromas. Similar dank hop flavors, fresh and nice; want more.
Bottle. Pours gold white head. Nose and taste of green onion, cracker malt, lemon, pine and grass. Medium body.

Bottle dated 3/4/15. Pours like hazy cantaloupe juice, with just a few millimeters of off-white head. Aroma is intense, with huge candied cantaloupe and honeydew notes as well as mango, lychee, sweet orange, and dank and floral hops. A bit of funk, too, like overripe fruit. Been a while since IÂ’ve gotten such a nectar-y nose on a beer, and the melon notes are unusual. Taste is sweet orange, mango, and cantaloupe agua fresca. Grassy and honeyed finish, low bitterness, low to medium carbonation. Manages to somehow be sticky and oily while still drinking fairly light, though I wouldnÂ’t call it crisp. Remarkable beer Â– straight-up hop juice.

Pours hazy gold into a tulip. White head with little retention recedes to hug rim. Mango and pineapple aromas. Soft and dry with caramel upfront turning to passionfruit and mango before the lasting lime and resin finish.
Jesus this is good. Ernesto with the mega share. Wow. So hoppy but not bitter. So juicy but not sweet. Fluffy, light, refreshing, lightly dry finish. Just an amazing beer.

Poured from bottle into tulip: pours orange with a one finger white head. Aroma of orange peel, garlic, and a bit of pine. Taste is a citrus bomb, with a bit more resin and a bitter finish. Great IPA.

bottle thanks to matt, he got it to me in a barrage of snowstorms. Incredible hoppy aroma, pine and citrus, mostly lighter flavors, nothing resiny or sticky here, Veyr light bitterness, all hop flavor and aroma as it should be, very light body, The PERFECT ipa.

750ml. Sticker saying 1/17/15. Bottled? Or day the store got it? Thanks to Paul for sending this as a sweet extra. Very cloudy yellow, it has that hill farmstead look to it. Aroma is juicy and full of citrus. Taste is slightly bitter. mild hops, big orange juicy. Body has a fizzy carbonation and is slightly thick, almost pulpy mouthfeel to go along with the orange pulp finish. Another top notch IPA from the New England area.

Bottle with a sticker stating 11/17/15 with thanks to Reynolds314! Pours cloudy orange, large off-white head that dissipates fairly slowly and leaves lots of sticky lacing. Aroma is very mosaic influenced, tropical stone fruits, dank notes, pine, spruce tips, some onion as well. Flavor is light sweet and light bitter, lots of dank piney onion grapefruit fruitiness going on. Not harsh at all. Medium body, creamy mouthfeel. Some lingering bitterness on the palate. Wonderful, glad to have gotten a chance to try it!

UPDATED: JAN 19, 2015 Good beer. Poured from bottle into tulip. Orange straw colored with light head. Aroma is mosaic overload with tons of orange peel, green onion, garlic, and dank weed, more subtle melon and tropical fruits. Taste is hop oils bitterness resin and mild sweetness. Straight mosaic hop juice but I like it.

750ml bottle in a teku. Pours hazy golden with a lacy, white head. Aroma of strong citrusy and fruity and floral hops, pale and light caramel malts, and some dough. Flavor the same with a great, fresh hoppiness. Average texture. A really cool beer.
